snippet: At least four million gene switches that reside in sections of the human genome once thought to be inactive turn out to have critical functions in the body, researchers reported.
abstract: Scientists report the human genome is packed with at least four million gene switches that reside in bits of DNA that once were dismissed as 'junk' but that turn out to play critical roles in controlling how cells, organs and other tissues behave; breakthrough study involving hundreds of researchers and published in numerous journals has enormous implications for human health because many diseases appear to be caused by these tiny changes in gene switches.
lead_paragraph: At least four million gene switches that reside in sections of the human genome once thought to be inactive turn out to have critical functions in the body, researchers reported.

headline.seo: Far From ‘Junk,’ DNA Dark Matter Proves Crucial to Health
headline.main: Bits of Mystery DNA, Far From ‘Junk,’ Play Crucial Role
headline.print_headline: Study Discovers Road Map of DNA; A Key to Biology

keywords.value: Encode Project (National Human Genome Research Institute)
